clip_assessment.verbatim_quote: Best advice has been always answer your phone... you never know what you're going to get.
clip_assessment.guest_voice: Karina speaks with practical confidence — no fluff, just straightforward wisdom delivered like advice from a mentor who's been there.
clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It challenges the modern agent's impulse to screen calls and control their time, suggesting the opposite might be the secret to breakthrough growth.

HOOK.text: Karina Chavez answered a 7pm call last Tuesday. It turned into a $480,000 listing by Thursday.
HOOK.production_note: Phone screen showing 7:04pm incoming call. Quick cut to Karina signing listing agreement two days later.

SETUP.text: She's a top 1% producer in Albuquerque who built her business entirely on referrals. Her number one rule? So simple most agents ignore it.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll of Karina at closing table, hugging clients. Her phone buzzing on the table throughout.

INSIGHT.text: "Always answer your phone. You never know what you're going to get." That Tuesday call? A past client's coworker whose agent went dark during inspection. She needed someone who'd actually pick up. Most agents saw a random evening number and let it ring. Karina answered on the second ring. Here's what nobody tells you — people don't want to leave voicemails about six-figure decisions. They want a human. Right now. And they'll move to the next agent in their contacts faster than you think.
INSIGHT.production_note: Show Karina's phone ringing at 7:04pm. Text overlay: 'Past client referral - needs agent NOW'. Cut to Karina answering enthusiastically. Show competitor's phone going to voicemail with 'call declined' animation.

REFRAME.text: You're at 30 deals this year and can't figure out why you're plateaued. Meanwhile, you sent four calls to voicemail last week because you were 'busy.' One of those could've been your easiest $15,000 of the year.
REFRAME.production_note: Split screen: Agent ignoring call while scrolling social media vs. calculator showing $15,000 commission. Agent's expression shifts from defensive to 'oh shit' realization.

CTA.text: Right now — not tomorrow — go into your phone settings. Turn off 'Silence Unknown Callers.' Then answer every single call for the next seven days. Keep a note in your phone: who called, what they wanted. Report back next Friday on what you found.
CTA.production_note: Screen recording showing iPhone Settings > Phone > Silence Unknown Callers being toggled OFF. Text overlay: 'ANSWER EVERY CALL - 7 DAYS' with checkbox. End on Karina answering phone with genuine smile.

caption: She answered at 7pm on a Tuesday. Listed it Thursday. Your phone isn't ringing less—you're just not answering. (via Karina Chavez)

_metadata.rewrite_changelog: Transformed vague hook into specific story with dollar amount and timeline. Developed the 7pm call into a complete narrative with stakes and outcome. Replaced reflective reframe with direct confrontation about their plateau. Completely rewrote CTA from passive 'track what happens' to three concrete steps: disable silence feature, answer for 7 days, document results. Made it impossible to misunderstand what to do next.
_metadata.judge_note: Add one specific story of a deal Karina won by answering — the 7pm call example is mentioned but not developed into an actual narrative.
